intro: Licania apetala var. aperta, commonly known as the open-flowered licania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest understories.
